content: लोकः [लोक्यतेऽसौ लोक्-घञ्] {@--1@} The world, a division of the universe; (roughly speaking there are three {%lokas%} स्वर्ग, पृथ्वी and पाताल, but according to fuller classification the {%lokas%} are fourteen, seven higher regions rising from the earth one above the other, {%<ab>i. e.</ab>%} भूर्लोक, भुवर्लोक, स्वर्लोक, महर्लोक, जनर्लोक, तपर्लोक, and सत्यलोक or ब्रह्मलोक; and seven lower regions, descending from the earth one below the other; {%<ab>i. e.</ab>%} अतल, वितल, सुतल, रसातल, तलातल, महातल and पाताल). {@--2@} The earth, terrestrial world (भूलोक); इहलोके in this world (<ab>opp.</ab> परत्र). {@--3@} The human race, mankind, men, as in लोकातिग, लोकोत्तर &c. <ab>q. v.</ab> {@--4@} The people or subjects (<ab>opp.</ab> the king); स्वसुखनिरभिलाषः खिद्यसे लोकहेतोः <ls>Ś. 5. 7</ls>; <ls>R. 4. 8.</ls> {@--5@} A collection, group, class, company; आकृष्टलीलान् नरलोकपालान् <ls>R. 6. 1</ls>; or शशाम तेन क्षितिपाललोकः <ls n="R.">7. 3.</ls> {@--6@} A region, tract, district, province. {@--7@} Common life, ordinary practice (of the world) लोकवत्तु लीलाकैवल्यं <ls>Br. Sūt. II. 1. 33</ls>; यथा लोके कस्यचिदाप्तैषणस्य राज्ञः &c. <ls>Ś. B.</ls> (and diverse other places of the same work). {@--8@} Common or worldly usage (<ab>opp.</ab> Vedic usage or idiom); वेदोक्ता वैदिकाः शब्दाः सिद्धा लोकाच्च लौकिकाः, प्रियतद्धिता दाक्षिणात्या यथा लोके वेदे चेति प्रयोक्तव्ये यथा लौकिकवैदिकेष्विति प्रयुंजते <ls>Mbh.</ls>; (and in diverse other places); अतोऽस्मि लोके वेदे च प्रथितः पुरुषोत्तमः <ls>Bg. 15. 18.</ls> {@--9@} Sight, looking. {@--10@} The number ‘seven’, or ‘fourteen’. {@--11@} <ab>Ved.</ab> Open space; space, room. (In compounds लोक is often translated by ‘universally’, ‘generally’, ‘popularly’; as लोकविज्ञात; so °विद्विष्ट).
